title.#cdata-section: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World

description.#cdata-section: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

title.#cdata-section: The situation in Jerusalem is boiling over. Here's how it all happened

description.#cdata-section: Israel said it struck targets belonging to the Palestinian militant group Hamas in southern Lebanon and Gaza early Friday, hours after dozens of rockets were fired from southern Lebanon into Israeli territory, which the Israeli military blamed on Palestinian militants.

title.#cdata-section: China hasn't given extensive aid to Russia's war effort in Ukraine, US Treasury officials say

description.#cdata-section: While China and Russia have strengthened ties since the Kremlin's brutal invasion of Ukraine, the US has not seen evidence that China has provided systemic material support to the Kremlin as Russian President Vladimir Putin and his government look for avenues to evade Western sanctions and backfill its military, according to senior US Treasury officials.

title.#cdata-section: Russia charges Wall Street Journal's Evan Gershkovich with espionage

description.#cdata-section: Russian investigators have formally charged Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich with espionage, Russian state media reported Friday, adding he denied the accusations.Â

title.#cdata-section: 'A symbol of Ukraine': This giant plane was destroyed in Russia's invasion. Now it may fly again

description.#cdata-section: The sheared nose cone of the Antonov An-225 cargo plane towers over Yevhen Bashynsky.

title.#cdata-section: Is the US economy 'unwell?' We're about to find out

description.#cdata-section: After months of a remarkably strong US labor market and economy, everything seems to be slowing down.

title.#cdata-section: What to expect from the jobs report on Friday

description.#cdata-section: The US labor market has kept trucking right along even as other areas of the economy have slowed.

title.#cdata-section: Here's why beef is still pricey

description.#cdata-section: A slowing economy may lead to a decline in sales of pricey beef cuts, but don't look for any bargains just yet.

title.#cdata-section: The Fed could easily drive Black unemployment much higher than the overall jobless rate

description.#cdata-section: Millions of jobs could be on the chopping block this year, as the Federal Reserve continues its rate-hiking campaign to tame inflation. But the effects of that action likely won't reverberate evenly across the economy.

title.#cdata-section: Switzerland cuts bonus payouts for top Credit Suisse management

description.#cdata-section: BERLIN -â Switzerland has instructed Credit Suisse to cancel or reduce all outstanding bonus payments for the top three levels of management and examine whether those already paid can be recovered, the Federal Council said on Wednesday.

title.#cdata-section: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too

description.#cdata-section: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

title.#cdata-section: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows

description.#cdata-section: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

title.#cdata-section: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?

description.#cdata-section: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

title.#cdata-section: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs

description.#cdata-section: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer FranÃ§ois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

title.#cdata-section: A 106-year-old has become Vogue's oldest ever cover model

description.#cdata-section: Vogue Philippines has revealed Apo Whang-Od as the cover star of its April issue, a move that makes the 106-year-old tattoo artist from the Philippines the oldest person ever to appear on the front of Vogue.

title.#cdata-section: Artists Gilbert & George open their own gallery, saying museums 'are too full up'

description.#cdata-section: Famed artist duo Gilbert & George, who describe themselves as two men who are together one artist, have unveiled a new gallery in London dedicated to their work.

title.#cdata-section: Dior stages spectacular runway show in India

description.#cdata-section: Dior hosted a landmark runway show in Mumbai on Thursday, a move nodding both to India's long-standing role in manufacturing European high fashion and the growing power of its luxury consumers.

title.#cdata-section: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings

description.#cdata-section: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

title.#cdata-section: Long-held theory about what inspired Monet confirmed

description.#cdata-section: In a letter to his wife in March 1901, pioneering French painter Claude Monet lamented the bad weather that prevented him from working, as well as another conspicuous impediment to his creativity.

title.#cdata-section: Amateur gold digger finds huge nugget worth $160,000 in Australia

description.#cdata-section: An amateur gold digger has found an enormous gold nugget worth 240,000 AUD ($160,000) in Australia.

title.#cdata-section: What happened when a couple bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside

description.#cdata-section: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

title.#cdata-section: 'This is not a zoo': Why sex workers are protesting in Amsterdam

description.#cdata-section: Overwhelmed by its own popularity, Amsterdam is ramping up its push to re-brand its "go wild" and "no rules" image. Drunken Brits are being told to stay home, there are moves to clamp down on cannabis, and the red lights could be about to go out on its city center brothels.

title.#cdata-section: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation

description.#cdata-section: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

title.#cdata-section: Off-the-radar destinations every China visitor should consider

description.#cdata-section: With China finally reopening to the world, it's time to dust off that travel wish list and start planning.

title.#cdata-section: Amsterdam asks 'wild' young male British tourists to 'stay away'

description.#cdata-section: Amsterdam is asking young British men to "stay away" if they plan to visit the city to cut loose and "go wild".
